georged

As a probable candidate for US Republican presidential primary election in 
 2000, assuming he can mend fences with the national committee, is McCain planning ahead with his current stance?
 
 His bill restricting administration from currently being able to define their own program for 'protecting America', banning torture, secret prisons in countries we buy and CIA exemption from all legislation has majority support in congress, administration fighting that tooth and nail. A version of Blair's recent experience of being reined in by his own party? Definitely a party line to soften his reputation as a rebel. 
 
 On the other hand, he's advocating enough resources including combat troops to secure Iraq. I view that as a red herring, especially with his Vietnam experience, to, in a few years, allow him use of the Nixon political strategy of political campaigning to get out of an unpopular war. Are we in that cycle again? 
 
 I'm not for or against McCain, just curious about his political strategy.
Poligeek

McCain it seems to me, is trying to stay VERY pro-war to keep the neo-con base happy, but is looking for ways to not be tied to the administrations blunders in terms of the execution of the plan in Iraq.
simone

Even though I am extremely liberal, I kind of liked McCain--until he kissed up to Bush after Bush and his people crapped all over him in South Carolina. The picture of McCain hugging Bush! Ick! No standards!
Bassman

John McCain is nothing more than another RINO. He is the media's darling from the GOP.

 RINO? McCain is a hand held GPS system?

jskufan

John McCain is nothing more than another RINO. 

 
 You say that like it's a bad thing, yet Republicans re-elected this administration for another four years. Since voter's obviously aren't checking candidates very closely for long time party ideologies, why reinvent the wheel. Besides, when the party is operating below a 40% national approval rating for the oval office, future success will come to those candidates that effectively convince voters how, and why, they are different from the status quo.
Bassman

Unfortunately, the Rockefeller "Republicans" have been infiltrating the party for some time, now. It's almost impossible to elect a true conservative, anymore.
 
 RINO-Republican In Name Only
georged

Besides, when the party is operating below a 40% national approval rating for the oval office, future success will come to those candidates that effectively convince voters how, and why, they are different from the status quo.

 
 Nixon had been beaten into the ground by Kennedy seeking the presidency in 1960 and at his 1962 run for CA governorship. His major campaign plank in 1968 was getting the US out of Vietnam; agreed, why reinvent the wheel.

 RINO-Republican In Name Only

 
 The Republican side of Rockefeller Family political ideology includes strong fiscal responsibility, something current administration obviously wouldn't recognize if their mythical god whispered it into their ear. It also includes domestic social responsibility, which has always been the responsibility of the wealthy, not the masses. 
 
 I'd gladly welcome a Rockefeller Republican compared to the gang of pirates currently in power.

 Fiscal and domestic social "responsibility?" Please refer to New York State and the Rockefeller mentality for the results. High taxes, an "anything goes" morality, a culture of death, big government, and useless social programs aren't the answer.
jskufan

Fiscal and domestic social "responsibility?" Please refer to New York State and the Rockefeller mentality for the results. High taxes, an "anything goes" morality, a culture of death, big government, and useless social programs aren't the answer.

 
 OK, so your state is in the top "5" ranking by state tax burden. What we're talking about is fiscal responsibility at the Federal level. What is your definition of a "Rockefeller Republican"? I think Georged, like myself, associates the Rockefeller name as being synonymous with accumulating wealth, as opposed to the current administration demonstrating how to deplete our national wealth. Basically, you could substitute any "old money" family name for "Rockefeller" if it makes you feel better.
